meanings.definition: To make gestures, especially while speaking.
meanings.sent1: She gesticulates wildly when telling stories to her friends.
meanings.sent2: He always gesticulates with his hands when he talks.
meanings.sent3: The comedian gesticulates comically during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement gesticulates like a dance of joy.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's gesticulates help the students remember the lesson better.

meanings.sent1: The mime gesticulates to convey emotions without words.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, people gesticulate more than they speak.
meanings.sent3: The alien gesticulates wildly, trying to explain its spaceship.
meanings.sent4: His silence gesticulates louder than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's gesticulates tell a story of love and loss on stage.
